content: :wave: everybody. Looks like Niko is running a bit late. How's everyone doing?
hello :wave: -- how are you ? (and everyone else)
:wave: hi all
wave
I'm here now!
Tired :smile: I'm UTC-7 XD
Heh :)

I myself have been very busy in the last few weeks unfortunately, so haven't been able to do as much as I'd hoped. including doing enough preparation for today's sprint. at least most of the topics for the last one still hold, and there have been a few interesting things to tackle since then
Well-- what do we all have in mind for the day :)
(I owe Domenic a review for example)
I've had a few ideas, but I thought a good place for me to start would be reviewing some PRs
for Niko I was thinking about this first:
I also wanted to toy with re-examining polonius's rules to be purely forward propagating
but ok let me hear what @lqd has in mind =)
I'd take that review :D
it's going to be quick, giving access to datafrog releases to everyone
Or rather if there are blockers left for merging the parser PR I'd start there today
like the crates policy
ie core team, t-compiler + contributors, wg, etc
(maybe frank as well)
I think rn only niko can make a datafrog release, and dylan has been doing great work on it, that we'd need to publish to use in polonius
that does seem suboptimal
I can fix that :)
(in theory, I tend to have weird problems with crates.io)

Domenic Quirl said:

I'd take that review :D

you'll have it today, most likely a r+, dear sir
was there stuff I ought to review?

I've got the Soufflé integration as a background task, but I'm going to try to tackle emitting outlives constraints from HRTBs today while I can ask Niko questions. I'd also like to discuss Location::All, since I think maybe it overlaps with Niko's ideas about switching away from liveness?
true
that's a good point
there are easy reviews of dylan's PRs for datafrog, which all look good to me, then we can make a release, unblocking their dual PRs in polonius (which we can also review)
There's actually a problem with rust-lang/datafrog#36 that I can fix pretty quick
I also have questions about the potential new rules ofc
think we can prototype them in soufflé already dylan ? or is the prototype not quite ready yet, I remember it being 13/16 ready
One administrative thing for Niko: Are you comfortable with me or lqd signing off on small datafrog/Polonius PRs? It would help us iterate a bit faster I think, since you've got other stuff going on.
I believe that they are indeed comfortable with that, so this may be a time of souls getting crushed (jk :3)

lqd said:

think we can prototype them in soufflé already dylan ? or is the prototype not quite ready yet, I remember it being 13/16 ready

Not quite, there's a bug somewhere, probably in the copy of the rules I have in-tree. It doesn't compute errors correctly for some of the test cases.
if you've used your previous markdown extraction, there were a couple of differences with the actual rules (a relation with different order) etc
@lqd ok I made compiler/wg-polonius/lang owners of datafrog. I can't add any other teams because I am not a member :)

Dylan MacKenzie (ecstatic-morse) said:

One administrative thing for Niko: Are you comfortable with me or lqd signing off on small datafrog/Polonius PRs? It would help us iterate a bit faster I think, since you've got other stuff going on.

I am
awesome thanks niko, https://crates.io/crates/datafrog looks good, very similar to polonius, so this should be enough
I wasn't clear on whether there is other stuff I should review
also, is the membership of wg-polonius "up to date"?
https://github.com/rust-lang/team/blob/master/teams/wg-polonius.toml#L7 looks plausible
@Domenic Quirl could perhaps be added :)
up to date enough yeah
sure, if they want to, this can be arranged easily :)
I guess I'd like the bar to be "landed some PRs and showed staying power"
more-or-less :)
agreed :)
If you want. I haven't done any actual work on the polonius implementation yet, so I'd have any changes I make reviewed regardless rn probably
we could talk about https://github.com/rust-lang/polonius/pull/157 but that does go back to the "liveness at all points" question anyways
which is related to the "stop using liveness" dada ideas
reviews happen either way, but I'd say let's hold off a bit until you've done a bit more PRs, @Domenic Quirl
seems fine

lqd said:

we could talk about https://github.com/rust-lang/polonius/pull/157 but that does go back to the "liveness at all points" question anyways

yes
tell you what
I am going to take 30 minutes or so to sketch out what I am thinking in a hackmd
I'll be around for questions of course
let me start up a topic for that

nikomatsakis said:

was there stuff I ought to review?

Most of my outstanding PRs (besides Soufflé integration, which isn't ready) are small, so unless lqd has something, I would focus on your design work.

I'd be interested in the new formulation, but I don't know how comfortable I am with implementation yet. But also I guess there's no point not doing anything because of that, I'll just have to get my feet wet
sounds good
even if no implementation work is done yet, it'll be at least good to spread knowledge around in any case
@Dylan MacKenzie (ecstatic-morse) you wanna work on landing your datafrog PRs so that we publish a release and unblock the other small PRs ?
@lqd Do you have something to work on? Or can you talk about placeholder liveness and/or Location::All for a moment?
nothing super pressing apart from domenic's review :)

lqd said:

Dylan MacKenzie (ecstatic-morse) you wanna work on landing your datafrog PRs so that we publish a release and unblock the other small PRs ?

Sure. I'll do that real quick.
we can talk about both
And you can review their PR
let's do that :thumbs_up:
(I have to leave for a few minutes but will continue reading the hackmd and replying and so on :)
just noting that maybe we should do the next sprints a tad later so that dylan doesn't have to wake up in the middle of the night for it
Nah, 7:00 am is fine.
Since I can just start work a bit later
alright
@Domenic Quirl @Dylan MacKenzie (ecstatic-morse) @nikomatsakis thank you all for your time today, we should do this again soon :)
I was going to say, @lqd, let's schedule the next one
does the bimonthly cadence still work for everyone ? if, so that would be the 10th of September

Huh, I actually have some appointments on that weekend. Right now it looks like Friday is not affected, but I'll only know for sure next week. I will be here the 24th, before I hopefully go on vacation the week after :)
Works for me. As long as I have notice Im flexible though.

lqd said:

does the bimonthly cadence still work for everyone ? if, so that would be the 10th of September

I can't actually do Sep 10
